intro: Dysoxylum aneityense, commonly known as the Malabar satinwood, is a tropical tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and large, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by orange-red fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in evergreen forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
